SEARCH
Package model

Class Ticket

java.lang.Object
model.Ticket
public class Ticket extends Object
Represents a flight ticket in the airport management system.

This class encapsulates all information related to an individual passenger's ticket for a specific flight. A ticket serves as the central entity that connects passengers to their flights and bookings, managing seat assignments, check-in status, and associated luggage.

The ticket maintains essential travel information including the unique ticket number, seat assignment, check-in status, and references to the associated flight, booking, and passenger. Each ticket represents one passenger's entitlement to travel on a specific flight.

Key features include:

  • Unique ticket number identification
  • Seat assignment and management
  • Check-in status tracking
  • Flight, booking, and passenger associations
  • Luggage management for the ticket holder
  • Seat representation in human-readable format

The class provides multiple constructors to accommodate different scenarios of ticket creation, from basic ticket information to comprehensive details including luggage and passenger data. All tickets require valid associations with flights, bookings, and passengers to maintain data integrity.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(String parTicketNumber, Flight parFlight, Booking parBooking, Passenger parPassenger) throws InvalidTicket, InvalidPassengerNumber, InvalidBooking, InvalidFlight
      Constructs a new ticket with basic flight, booking, and passenger information.

      Creates a ticket with essential associations to flight, booking, and passenger. The seat assignment defaults to null and check-in status defaults to false. This constructor is used for basic ticket creation scenarios.

      Parameters:
      parTicketNumber - the unique ticket number
      parFlight - the flight for this ticket
      parBooking - the booking containing this ticket
      parPassenger - the passenger for this ticket
      Throws:
      InvalidTicket - if the ticket number is null
      InvalidPassengerNumber - if the passenger is null
      InvalidBooking - if the booking is null
      InvalidFlight - if the flight is null

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(String parTicketNumber, int parSeat, Flight parFlight, Booking parBooking, Passenger parPassenger) throws InvalidTicket, InvalidPassengerNumber, InvalidBooking, InvalidFlight
      Constructs a new ticket with seat assignment.

      Creates a ticket with a specific seat assignment in addition to the basic flight, booking, and passenger associations. This constructor is used when seat selection is made during ticket creation.

      Parameters:
      parTicketNumber - the unique ticket number
      parSeat - the assigned seat number
      parFlight - the flight for this ticket
      parBooking - the booking containing this ticket
      parPassenger - the passenger for this ticket
      Throws:
      InvalidTicket - if the ticket number is null
      InvalidPassengerNumber - if the passenger is null
      InvalidBooking - if the booking is null
      InvalidFlight - if the flight is null

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(String parTicketNumber, int parSeat, boolean parCheckedIn, Flight parFlight, Booking parBooking, Passenger parPassenger) throws InvalidTicket, InvalidPassengerNumber, InvalidBooking, InvalidFlight
      Constructs a new ticket with seat assignment and check-in status.

      Creates a ticket with seat assignment and check-in status information. This constructor is used for tickets where check-in has already been processed or for importing existing ticket data.

      Parameters:
      parTicketNumber - the unique ticket number
      parSeat - the assigned seat number
      parCheckedIn - the check-in status
      parFlight - the flight for this ticket
      parBooking - the booking containing this ticket
      parPassenger - the passenger for this ticket
      Throws:
      InvalidTicket - if the ticket number is null
      InvalidPassengerNumber - if the passenger is null
      InvalidBooking - if the booking is null
      InvalidFlight - if the flight is null

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(String parTicketNumber, int parSeat, boolean parCheckedIn, Flight parFlight, Booking parBooking, Passenger parPassenger, List<Luggage> parLuggages) throws InvalidTicket, InvalidPassengerNumber, InvalidBooking, InvalidFlight
      Constructs a new ticket with luggage information.

      Creates a comprehensive ticket with seat assignment, check-in status, and associated luggage. This constructor establishes the ticket-luggage relationships and is used for complete ticket creation with baggage.

      Parameters:
      parTicketNumber - the unique ticket number
      parSeat - the assigned seat number
      parCheckedIn - the check-in status
      parFlight - the flight for this ticket
      parBooking - the booking containing this ticket
      parPassenger - the passenger for this ticket
      parLuggages - the list of luggage associated with this ticket
      Throws:
      InvalidTicket - if the ticket number is null
      InvalidPassengerNumber - if the passenger is null
      InvalidBooking - if the booking is null
      InvalidFlight - if the flight is null

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(String parTicketNumber, Integer parSeat, boolean parCheckedIn, String parId, String parCompanyName, Date parDate, Time parDepartureTime, Time parArrivalTime, FlightStatus parFlightStatus, int parMaxSeats, int parFreeSeats, String parOrigin, int parArrivalDelay, BookingStatus parBookingStatus, Customer parBuyer, Date parBookingDate, String parFirstName, String parLastName, String parSSN, Date parBirthDate) throws InvalidTicket, InvalidBuyer, InvalidFlight, InvalidPassengerNumber
      Constructs a new ticket with complete flight and booking data.

      Creates a ticket by constructing the associated flight and booking objects from individual parameters. This constructor is typically used when creating tickets from database records or external data sources where separate flight and booking objects don't exist yet.

      Parameters:
      parTicketNumber - the unique ticket number
      parSeat - the assigned seat number (can be null)
      parCheckedIn - the check-in status
      parId - the flight ID
      parCompanyName - the airline company name
      parDate - the flight date
      parDepartureTime - the flight departure time
      parArrivalTime - the flight arrival time
      parFlightStatus - the flight status
      parMaxSeats - the maximum seats on the flight
      parFreeSeats - the available seats on the flight
      parOrigin - the flight origin (for arriving flights)
      parArrivalDelay - the arrival delay in minutes
      parBookingStatus - the booking status
      parBuyer - the customer who made the booking
      parBookingDate - the booking creation date
      parFirstName - the passenger's first name
      parLastName - the passenger's last name
      parSSN - the passenger's social security number
      parBirthDate - the passenger's birth date
      Throws:
      InvalidTicket - if the ticket number is null
      InvalidBuyer - if the buyer is invalid
      InvalidFlight - if flight creation fails
      InvalidPassengerNumber - if passenger creation fails

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(String parTicketNumber, Integer parSeat, boolean parCheckedIn, Flight parFlight, Booking parBooking, String parFirstName, String parLastName, String parSSN, Date parBirthDate) throws InvalidTicket, InvalidFlight, InvalidBooking, InvalidPassengerNumber
      Constructs a new ticket with passenger details and existing flight/booking.

      Creates a ticket with existing flight and booking objects while creating a new passenger from individual parameters. This constructor is useful when flight and booking objects already exist but passenger information needs to be created from separate data fields.

      Parameters:
      parTicketNumber - the unique ticket number
      parSeat - the assigned seat number (can be null)
      parCheckedIn - the check-in status
      parFlight - the existing flight object
      parBooking - the existing booking object
      parFirstName - the passenger's first name
      parLastName - the passenger's last name
      parSSN - the passenger's social security number
      parBirthDate - the passenger's birth date
      Throws:
      InvalidTicket - if the ticket number is null
      InvalidFlight - if the flight is null
      InvalidBooking - if the booking is null
      InvalidPassengerNumber - if passenger creation fails

  • Method Details

    • getTicketNumber

      public String getTicketNumber()
      Gets the unique ticket number.

      Returns the ticket number that uniquely identifies this ticket within the system. This number is used for all ticket operations and passenger services.

      Returns:
      the ticket number, never null

    • getSeat

      public Integer getSeat()
      Gets the seat number assigned to this ticket.

      Returns the seat assignment for this ticket. The value can be null if no seat has been assigned, or -1 to indicate no seat assignment. The seat number corresponds to the aircraft's seating layout.

      Returns:
      the seat number, can be null or -1 for no assignment

    • setSeat

      public void setSeat(Integer seat)
      Sets the seat number for this ticket.

      Updates the seat assignment for this ticket. This method is used for seat selection and reassignment operations. The seat number should correspond to valid seats in the aircraft's layout.

      Parameters:
      seat - the new seat number, can be null for no assignment

    • isCheckedIn

      public boolean isCheckedIn()
      Gets the check-in status of this ticket.

      Returns whether the passenger has completed check-in procedures for this ticket. This status affects boarding eligibility and various airport services.

      Returns:
      true if checked in, false otherwise

    • setCheckedIn

      public void setCheckedIn(boolean checkedIn)
      Sets the check-in status for this ticket.

      Updates the check-in status when passengers complete or reverse check-in procedures. This method is used by check-in systems and airport operations.

      Parameters:
      checkedIn - the new check-in status

    • getFlight

      public Flight getFlight()
      Gets the flight associated with this ticket.

      Returns the flight object that this ticket is valid for. This reference is immutable and provides access to all flight-related information and operations.

      Returns:
      the associated flight, never null
      See Also:
      • Flight

    • getBooking

      public Booking getBooking()
      Gets the booking associated with this ticket.

      Returns the booking object that contains this ticket. This reference is immutable and provides access to booking-related information and customer details.

      Returns:
      the associated booking, never null
      See Also:
      • Booking

    • getPassenger

      public Passenger getPassenger()
      Gets the passenger associated with this ticket.

      Returns the passenger object representing the person who will travel using this ticket. This reference is immutable and provides access to passenger information.

      Returns:
      the associated passenger, never null
      See Also:
      • Passenger

    • getLuggages

      public List<Luggage> getLuggages()
      Gets the list of luggage associated with this ticket.

      Returns all luggage items that belong to the passenger holding this ticket. The list may be empty if no luggage has been registered for this ticket.

      Returns:
      the list of luggage, never null but may be empty
      See Also:
      • Luggage

    • setLuggages

      public void setLuggages(List<Luggage> luggages)
      Sets the list of luggage for this ticket.

      Updates the complete list of luggage associated with this ticket. This method establishes the ticket-luggage relationships and is used for baggage management operations. Each luggage item will have its ticket reference updated to point to this ticket.

      Parameters:
      luggages - the new list of luggage items
      See Also:
      • Luggage

    • printSeat

      public String printSeat()
      Returns a human-readable representation of the seat assignment.

      Converts the numeric seat assignment to a standard airline format using row numbers and letter designations (A-F). Returns "/" if no seat is assigned (null or -1). The format follows standard aircraft seating conventions.

      Examples:

      • Seat 0 → "1A"
      • Seat 5 → "1F"
      • Seat 6 → "2A"
      • No seat → "/"
      Returns:
      the formatted seat designation or "/" for no assignment
